Also Wednesday, Scotland Yard, which some have criticized for what they called a lax investigation, said it would reopen its own inquiries, saying it had received significant new information relating to allegations of phone hacking at The News of the World in 2005/06. The Crown Prosecution Service also recently said it would expand its review of evidence gathered by the police to include any "recent or new substantive allegations."
